title: New Git repository
longDescription: Source code from your existing repository will be migrated to a new repository in IBM Hosted Git. You can engage in social coding through wikis, issue tracking, and pull requests.

existing_repo_url.title: Existing Git Repository
existing_repo_url.description: This is the repository from where the source code will be imported.

private_repo.title: Private Repository
private_repo.description: Select this check box to create a private repository.

has_issues.title: Enable GitLab Issues
has_issues.description: Enable GitLab Issues page for lightweight issue tracking.

enable_traceability.title: Track deployment of code changes
enable_traceability.description: Select this check box to track the deployment of code changes by creating tags, labels and comments on commits, pull requests and referenced issues.

migrateTAndP.title: Do you wish to migrate Track & Plan Work Items to GitLab Issues?
migrateTAndP.description: Track & Plan Work Items will be created as GitLab Issues in your newly created repository

labels.title: GitLab Issues use labels to track attributes. You can select which Track & Plan Work Item attributes to map to labels in your new GitLab Issues here:

form.title: Track & Plan Migration
form.description: Details for setting up the migration of your Track & Plan Work Items

items.title:
Your newly created toolchain uses GitLab Issues for Issue tracking.  
			      
			To keep your existing Track & Plan data it must be transferred to GitLab Issues now. [Detailed info available here](https://console.ng.bluemix.net/docs/services/ContinuousDelivery/upgrade_projects.html)
Specify the name of the [Track & Plan Query]({{rtcSharedQueriesLink}}) to select the Work Items to be migrated
items.description: Work Items will be selected based on this Query (from Shared Queries). If Query is not specified, all Work Items are selected.
Track & Plan data will not be migrated.
